title: Why is Bitcoin superior to gold in every way? Saifedean Ammous explains
body: American economist Saifedean Ammous argues that Bitcoin is superior to gold because it has a fixed supply, is digital, and is not controlled by governments, making it a better store of value and a solution to inflation and debt issues in today‚Äôs financial systems. Ammous, author of The Bitcoin Standard , argues in a recent interview that Bitcoin is superior to gold. He believes Bitcoin is a revolutionary form of money. Its fixed supply and decentralized nature make it more reliable than gold. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what #Bitcoin fixes. If we go back to having a HARD money where money is no longer debt, we no longer need to be monetizing debt. We no longer need to get everyone to become a debt slave in order for us to have a form of money.‚Äù ‚Äì @saifedean w/ @JoeSquawk üéØ pic.twitter.com/Tb3HLT2n4o ‚Äî Walker‚ö°Ô∏è (@WalkerAmerica) December 13, 2024 Bitcoin vs. gold Ammous explains that while gold has historically been used as money due to its scarcity and store of value properties, Bitcoin has taken these qualities to a new level. ‚ÄúGold has been used for 4,000 years because it stores value well. But the problem with Gold is that it‚Äôs not as scarce as Bitcoin,‚Äù Ammous states. ‚ÄúThe annual increase in gold supply is around 1.5% to 2%, whereas Bitcoin‚Äôs supply is capped at 21 million, and its annual supply growth rate is even lower‚Äîabout 0.8% during its current four-year period,‚Äù he added. On e of the advantages Bitcoin has over gold is its fixed supply, which is set in stone. ‚Äú There‚Äôs only ever going to be 21 million Bitcoin. That‚Äôs it. It‚Äôs a simple fact, and no other form of money can claim such a property,‚Äù Ammous continues. This scarcity makes Bitcoin a somewhat deflationary asset, unlike fiat currencies that governments can print in unlimited quantities. Am mous believes this unique property makes Bitcoin a much stronger store of value compared to gold or any government-issued currency. Another key difference is how Bitcoin operates. While gold relies on physical storage and transport, Bitcoin is purely digital, meaning it can be transferred and stored globally without needing physical handling. ‚ÄúBitcoin is just software. It doesn‚Äôt require a legal framework that is tied to government-backed currencies. It‚Äôs decentralized and automated,‚Äù Ammous points out. He contrasts this with fiat money, which is deeply intertwined with government control and monetary policy. Why Bitcoin is the future of money Ammous also highlights the importance of Bitcoin‚Äôs ability to prevent inflation. Unlike fiat currencies, which lose value over time as central banks print more money, Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply makes it impervious to inflationary pressures. ‚ÄúIn the world of fiat, governments continuously increase the supply of money, which leads to a decrease in its value,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúIn the case of Bitcoin, no one can just print more. It‚Äôs a money that cannot be inflated.‚Äù Ammous stresses the issue of debt in today‚Äôs financial systems. ‚ÄúFiat money is built on the concept of debt. Every time the government needs more money, they increase the currency supply, essentially creating more debt,‚Äù he states. This creates a cycle of borrowing and inflation that benefits the government but harms everyday citizens who watch their savings lose value. In contrast, Bitcoin provides a way out of this system. ‚ÄúWith Bitcoin, you don‚Äôt need to be in debt to participate in the economy. It‚Äôs a form of money that doesn‚Äôt require borrowing or printing,‚Äù he says. The economist believes that Bitcoin‚Äôs technological advantages and fixed supply make it the ideal money for the modern age. ‚ÄúB itcoin is a form of money that is more scarce, portable, and secure than gold,‚Äù he concludes. ‚ÄúIt offers a solution to the problems caused by fiat currencies and offers a future where money is no longer tied to government debt and manipulation.‚Äù With more people realizing Bitcoin‚Äôs revolutionary potential, its value continues to rise as a monetary asset that will outlast and outperform gold in the coming years. title: Morocco Shifts to Crypto Embrace After Years of Ban
body: The government of Morocco has strategically pivoted from a strict crypto ban to an embrace of digital assets. This surprising turn of event was after the government outlawed the use of crypto in the country in 2017. The decision was part of a global trend in which many countries were skeptical about crypto‚Äôs volatile and unregulated nature. The nation is now laying the groundwork to embrace crypto assets and regulate the sector. Morocco Shift in Strategy: From Crypto Ban to Regulation Back then, the government cited financial instability, terrorism financing, and money laundering as the reasons for banning crypto in the country. The decision seemed like the best way to protect the country‚Äôs economy. In 2024, Morocco‚Äôs financial landscape is now undergoing a profound transformation. The announcement by Bank Al-Maghrib, Morocco‚Äôs central bank, to draft crypto regulations marks a pivotal moment. Central bank governor Abdellatif Jouahri has confirmed that the draft is under review, signaling a commitment to bringing crypto into the formal economy. This change aligns Morocco with a global trend of evolving digital asset regulations. Countries that were once critical of crypto, including China and Bolivia are now developing frameworks to harness its potential . Interestingly, over 130 nations are exploring Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). Morocco‚Äôs shift to crypto aims to boost financial inclusion. This is because 42% of the population are still unbanked. Crypto and a future CBDC can bridge this gap. Also smartphones, crypto wallets can enable savings, investments, and cross-border payments. Crypto‚Äôs Underground Rise in Morocco Despite the 2017 ban, cryptocurrencies found fertile ground in Morocco‚Äôs informal economy. In 2023, the country was ranked among the top 20 globally for crypto adoption, according to Chainalysis. It was also listed 13th in Bitcoin usage by Insider Monkey. Ownership of cryptocurrencies steadily climbed, rising from 2.4% of the population in 2021 to 3.1% in 2022. The ban didn‚Äôt stop crypto but pushed it into unregulated underground markets without protections. This exposed the need for formal rules to manage risks and unlock its potential. Challenges on the Road Ahead While Morocco‚Äôs embrace of crypto holds promise, it comes with significant challenges. The government must establish clear regulations to govern transactions and exchanges. This includes efficient Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know-Your-Customer (KYC) measures to prevent misuse. Many citizens remain unfamiliar with cryptocurrencies. This makes public education essential to promote understanding and responsible use. To support adoption, Morocco needs reliable technological infrastructure. This includes securing platforms for transactions and better internet access in rural areas. The authorities need to integrate crypto with traditional banking systems to ensure stability and consumer protection. Additionally, stringent cybersecurity measures need to be in place to protect users against fraud and hacking. Also, international collaboration will help Morocco align its policies with global standards and maintain financial integrity. title: CFTC Sues Washington Pastor for $6M Cryptocurrency Ponzi Scheme
body: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has filed a civil enforcement action against Francier Obando Pinillo, a pastor from Pasco, Washington, accusing him of running a fraudulent cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme worth at least $5.9 million. The complaint names Pinillo and his associated businesses, Solanofi, Solano Partners Ltd., and Solano Capital Investments, collectively known as the Solanofi entities, as the defendants. Details of The Lawsuit According to a December 10 release from the CFTC, Pinillo targeted at least 1,515 individuals in the United States, including members of his Spanish-speaking congregation. The complaint alleges that he misused his position as a trusted church pastor to promote his deceptive scheme. He claimed to be the CEO of Solanofi, an automated trading platform that offered risk-free profits through high-performance trading of crypto assets. Pinillo falsely advertised guaranteed monthly returns of up to 34.9% and assured participants that the platform was secure and reliable. The pastor gave participants access to an online dashboard showing fake account balances and profits to make the scheme appear legitimate. He also encouraged customers to involve friends and family by offering a 15% referral fee for recruiting new people. However, the document states that there was no trading platform, no trades occurred, and no profits were generated. Instead, Pinillo allegedly misappropriated all funds provided by customers. The lawsuit further claims that the accused failed to disclose critical information when seeking clients. Among the omissions, he did not inform customers that the Solanofi entities were shams, the trading platform was non-existent, and the online account statements were falsified. Additionally, he used the funds from new participants to pay earlier ones in what the CFTC described as a classic Ponzi scheme. Restitution and Similar Cases Following the enforcement action, the regulator is seeking restitution for defrauded participants, the return of misappropriated funds, civil monetary penalties, trading bans, and a permanent injunction to prevent further violations of the Commodity Exchange Act and related rules. The case against Pinillo is the latest in a growing number of such schemes in the crypto industry. In March, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) alleged that 17 individuals were responsible for a $300 million Ponzi scheme that targeted more than 40,000 Latino investors through a program called CryptoFX. In August, the financial watchdog also brought complaints against two Georgia brothers accused of defrauding over 80 investors in a $60 million bogus multilevel plan. The same month, NovaTech Ltd. was charged with operating a fake operation that raised over $650 million from more than 200,000 investors, including many in the Haitian-American community. title: Japanese Lawmaker Makes Push For Strategic Bitcoin Reserve
body: A Japanese lawmaker has called on the government to adopt a strategic Bitcoin reserve to be at the fore of global financial innovation. This follows similar efforts by legislators in the United States, Russia, Argentina, and other jurisdictions. As a finite asset, a strategic Bitcoin reserve is key for consumers‚Äô economic benefits and utility in cross-border payments. According to the House of Councilors document, Satoshi Hamada moved towards a Bitcoin Reserve for the government. He described the importance of the country having the top crypto as its national asset. Hamada proposed converting foreign reserves to crypto assets like Bitcoin, pointing to global jurisdictions. The lawmaker cited neutrality and its decentralized nature to prevent any form of control within a particular country. Global trade with Bitcoin is possible without the influence of specific countries. Crypto enthusiasts argue that it creates a fair financial environment for participants. The initial reaction from the crypto community was positive, as holders lauded the recent push by governments toward digital asset adoption. This could spur institutional investment, raising asset prices and driving market innovation. Although Hamada‚Äôs party holds only two seats in parliament, there is growing optimism of other lawmakers supporting his views. Japan has taken a mixed approach toward digital asset regulation. Last month, the country proposed a lightweight regulation for crypto intermediaries. As global regulations ramp up, crypto enthusiasts believe the country will be more positive to virtual assets. The United States Effect Recent moves by US lawmakers inspired Hamada to pitch a strategic Bitcoin reserve. Ahead of the US elections, Donald Trump backed the crypto industry, pledging positive regulations and ending the present administration‚Äôs ‚Äú war‚Äù on the market. Amongst others, Trump noted that his administration would stop the sale of the nation‚Äôs Bitcoin, creating a reserve. US Senator Cynthia Lummis rolled out a bill for a strategic Bitcoin reserve in a related effort. The bill seeks to make the country a Bitcoin power nation as it will acquire 1 million BTC for five years and hold for 20 years. This will offset the growing national debt, which continues to hinder macro conditions in the market. Sen Lummis proposed selling gold reserves to acquire more Bitcoin, sparking an upward trend among bulls. This has led to several jurisdictions setting sights on a strategic BTC reserve to boost fair competition.

title: Can 1 million Bitcoin really pay off the $36 trillion U.S. national debt? Peter Schiff doubts
body: Peter Schiff doubts that 1 million Bitcoins could ever pay off the U.S. national debt, as Bitcoin‚Äôs market cap would need to increase by over 20,000%, which is unrealistic. He also questions Bitcoin‚Äôs global adoption and sees its value increased more by speculation than real demand. Some Bitcoin fans believe that if the U.S. government buys 1 million Bitcoins, it could eventually pay off the massive $36 trillion national debt. However, Peter Schiff doubts this idea, in a recent X post he questioned whether Bitcoin could eventually pay off the $36.25 trillion national debt. For this to happen, Bitcoin‚Äôs total value would have to increase significantly. Currently, Bitcoin is priced at around $100,000. So, 1 million Bitcoin at $100,000 per Bitcoin would be worth $100 billion in total, not enough to pay off the U.S. national debt, which is around $36.25 trillion. Peter Schiff doubts Bitcoin‚Äôs ability to pay off U.S. National debt Schiff says this isn‚Äôt possible, as Bitcoin would have to increase in value by over 20,000%, which is unrealistic. Even if Bitcoin‚Äôs value increases, the U.S. debt keeps growing. The U.S. government borrows money yearly, so the debt is expected to continue rising. This makes the idea of Bitcoin paying off the debt even harder to believe. Plus, by then the National Debt will be much more than $36.25 trillion, requiring a much higher Bitcoin price to pay it off. ‚Äî Peter Schiff (@PeterSchiff) December 13, 2024 Peter Schiff has long criticized Bitcoin, saying it lacks value and won‚Äôt replace traditional money or assets like gold. title: MicroStrategy to join Nasdaq-100 Index following Bitcoin-driven stock surge
body: MicroStrategy, the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin, will officially join the Nasdaq-100 index effective Dec. 23. The company‚Äôs inclusion follows an eventful year that saw its stock value increase more than sixfold. The Nasdaq-100 index is up 29.4% in 2024. You might also like: Saylor‚Äôs MicroStrategy added $2.1b in Bitcoin What does it mean? Joining the Nasdaq-100 index ranks MicroStrategy, the software company turned Bitcoin ( BTC ) treasury, among some of the biggest corporations, including Apple Inc., with a market cap exceeding $3 trillion; Microsoft Corporation, valued at over $2 trillion; NVIDIA Corporation, boasting a market cap surpassing $1 trillion; Amazon.com Inc., with its market cap of around $1.5 trillion; and Alphabet Inc., which has a market cap nearing $1.8 trillion. Other newcomers to the index this year include Palantir Technologies and Axon Enterprise. This inclusion typically leads to increased stock purchases as exchange-traded funds, or ETFs, tracking the index adjust their holdings to reflect the changes. To be included in the Nasdaq-100, a company must meet specific criteria and maintain a position of prominence in the stock market. For MicroStrategy, it‚Äôs among the 100 largest non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq stock exchange based on market capitalization. Inclusion also signifies that the company is among the most valuable and must maintain its stock performance to stay included. Poor performance or a drop in market cap can lead to exclusion, as was the case this year with Illumina, Super Micro Computer, and Moderna. MicroStrategy‚Äôs transformation The firm began acquiring Bitcoin in 2020 as a treasury reserve asset amid declining software business revenue. The strategy has proven remarkably successful, with the company‚Äôs market capitalization now approaching $97.94 billion. The firm recently expanded its Bitcoin holdings further, with Executive Chairman Michael Saylor announcing the acquisition of 21,550 Bitcoin for approximately $2.1 billion between December 2 and December 8, bringing their total holdings to 423,650 BTC. Bernstein analysts view the Nasdaq-100 inclusion as a stepping stone toward potential S&P 500 inclusion in 2025, suggesting further upside for the company‚Äôs stock. The analysts anticipate improved visibility and recognition beyond fresh ETF inflows as a result of the index inclusion.MicroStrategy‚Äôs stock performance has closely tracked Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements, benefiting from the cryptocurrency‚Äôs recent surge past $100,000. This rally has been partially attributed to optimism surrounding President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs victory and expectations of more favorable regulatory conditions for the crypto sector. The company‚Äôs success has redefined corporate treasury management strategies, showcasing the potential benefits of Bitcoin as a reserve asset. MicroStrategy‚Äôs approach has lured attention from institutional investors and corporate treasurers. This development represents a major milestone in the mainstream acceptance of Bitcoin-focused business strategies, as MicroStrategy becomes one of the few companies with substantial cryptocurrency exposure to join a major stock index. The inclusion in the Nasdaq-100 validates the company‚Äôs Bitcoin-centric approach and could encourage other corporations to consider similar strategies for treasury management.
